title: Fortify
shortDescription: Inject code and manipulate HTTP headers on incoming traffic
longDescription:
**Need to add or remove HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?
**Need to inject JavaScript on any page on your domain?

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Inject arbitrary JavaScript on any part on your domain
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching
* One-click management of the most important security and performance headers
* Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.
author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Enrich your requests with custom HTTP headers
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

Features:
- Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
- Route-based configurations with wildcard matching (Pro Tier)

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html) to see it in action and read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

gettingStarted10.helpvalue: üìñ Read the docs for more information.

gettingStarted101.helpvalue: üëÄ Check out the tutorials for step-by-step installation instructions.

gettingStarted2.helpvalue: üî• Portzilla can proxy traffic from any URL (including subdomains) to another service running on the same domain. Simply map the Route URL to the Target Port.

gettingStarted3.helpvalue: üî• Route URLs must include a hostname to resolve correctly.

gettingStarted7.helpvalue: üî• Custom Headers will be sent with each request to the service listening on Target Port.

gettingStarted8.helpvalue: üî• You can add a Custom Error Page that will render if your service isn't responding. Portzilla will show a default error page if you don't add one.

gettingStarted9.helpvalue: üî• Routes can be reordered in the UI below for organization but this won't have any other effect on Portzilla.

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Fortify your requests with custom HTTP headers
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

Features:
- Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
- Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching (Pro Tier)

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Fortify your requests with custom HTTP headers
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

Features:
- Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
- Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching (Pro Tier)
- Managed headers (coming soon)

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html) for complete information.

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Fortify your requests with custom HTTP headers
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

Features:
- Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
- Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching (Pro Tier)
- Managed headers (coming soon)

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html) for complete information.

proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

Features:
- Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
- Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching (Pro Tier)
- Managed headers (coming soon)

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html) for complete information.

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Managed security and custom headers for your site traffic
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching

**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching
* Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS
* One-click management of the most important security and performance headers

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

products.shortDescription: Custom request and response headers on all incoming traffic
products.longDescription: Attach customizable HTTP headers to every incoming request to your site.

products.title: Pro
products.shortDescription: Route-based header configuration with wildcard matching
products.longDescription: Attach route-based HTTP headers with wildcard matching and more.

products.title: Fortified

products.longDescription: Everything in Pro + Managed security and performance headers with enforced HTTPS.

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Managed security and custom headers for your site traffic
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Want to add HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?**  Fortify is packed with essential *request and response headers* and is part of a well balanced breakfast.  Get started for **free**.

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching
* Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS
* One-click management of the most important security and performance headers

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.title: Fortify
proposedApp.shortDescription: Inject code and manipulate HTTP headers on incoming traffic
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Need to add or remove HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?
**Need to inject JavaScript on any page on your domain?

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Inject arbitrary JavaScript on any part on your domain
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching
* One-click management of the most important security and performance headers
* Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.

proposedApp.longDescription:
**Need to add or remove HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?
**Need to inject JavaScript on any page on your domain?

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Inject arbitrary JavaScript on any part on your domain
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching
* One-click management of the most important security and performance headers
* Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

proposedApp.shortDescription: Inject code and manipulate HTTP headers on incoming traffic
proposedApp.longDescription:
**Need to add or remove HTTP headers to your network traffic without modifying your source code?
**Need to inject JavaScript on any page on your domain?

[Check out Fortify in action](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page).

Plus, HTTPS-enforcement and performance and security header management in a few clicks.

Features:
* Configure HTTP headers on incoming network traffic
* Inject arbitrary JavaScript on any part on your domain
* Route-based configurations with built-in wildcard matching
* One-click management of the most important security and performance headers
* Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS

Check out the [demo](https://www.networkchimp.com/tutorials/fortify.html?ref=app-page) to see it in action.
Read the [docs](https://www.networkchimp.com/docs/fortify.html?ref=app-page) for complete information.
proposedApp.author: Network Chimp

bodyScripts.description: HTML that will be injected at the end of the body tag.
bodyScripts.title: Injected Body Code

explanation.helpvalue: Content Security Policy (CSP) is a powerful and highly configureable layer of security that helps neutralize several kinds of popular attack vectors. Learn more

links.helpvalue: Use this tool to set up your CSP. When you're done, paste your CSP headers into the Response Headers section above.

enforceHTTPS.description: Redirect insecure HTTP requests to HTTPS and forbid insecure POST data.
enforceHTTPS.title: Enforce HTTPS

explanation.helpvalue: A server can set Fingerprint Headers to identify itself like X-Powered-By: PHP 5.4.37 or Server: LiteSpeed. This information facilitates exploitation of known vulnerabilities in the server architecture. Learn more

setTo.description: Use another common value to confuse attackers.
setTo.title: Set header

explanation.helpvalue: Indicate whether a browser should be allowed to render your site in an iframe, frame, embed, or object. Most sites don't need to be embeddable and this can help prevent clickjacking attacks. Learn more

headScripts.description: HTML that will be injected at the end of the head tag.
headScripts.title: Injected Head Code

help0.helpvalue: üìñ A Route tells Fortify how to modify requests matching Route URL. [See Docs]

disableIncludeSubdomains.description: Only enforce HSTS on your root domain but not subdomains.
disableIncludeSubdomains.title: Exclude subdomains

explanation.helpvalue: Force browsers to make secure HTTPS connections when they visit a specified website to prevent cookie highjacking and protocol downgrade attacks. Learn more

maxAge.description: Browsers will visit using HTTPS for this duration in seconds
maxAge.title: Max Age

preload.description: Tell browsers to preload your site as HTTPS-only (enrollment required). Learn more
preload.title: Preload your domain

explanation.helpvalue: Direct browsers not to infer MIME types on script and other tags that can lead to security vulnerabilities Learn more
Attempt to evict your site resources from the requesting browser's cache. Learn more
Controls how much referrer information (sent via the Referer header) should be included with requests. Learn more

removedRequestHeaders.description: Headers that will be removed from each request to the origin. Each header should be separated with a new line.
removedRequestHeaders.title: Deleted Request Headers

removedResponseHeaders.description: Headers that will be removed from each response from the origin. Each header should be separated with a new line.
removedResponseHeaders.title: Deleted Response Headers

requestHeaders.description: Headers that will be added to each request to the origin. Each header should be separated with a new line.
requestHeaders.placeholder: Dear-Server: Hello, hope you are well
requestHeaders.title: Request Headers

responseHeaders.description: Headers that will be added to each response from the origin. Each header should be separated with a new line.
responseHeaders.title: Response Headers

routeName.description: Memo to remind yourself what this configuration is doing.
routeName.placeholder: Adds security headers and a thoughtful request header
routeName.title: Configuration Notes

routeUrl.description: Modifications will be made to traffic on this URL.
routeUrl.title: Route URL *

explanation.helpvalue: Prefetch DNS requests to reduce page load times. Learn more
Cross-side scripting accounts for a majority of security vulnerabilities on the web. XSS protection headers are an important part of your mitigation strategy. Learn more

reportUri.description: Specify a location to send XSS violation reports
reportUri.title: Report URI

welcome0.helpvalue:
Fortify your HTTP requests with request and response headers of your choice.
  • Fine-grain HTTP header control packed into powerful, route-based configurations
  • One-click set up and management of essential security and technical headers including Content-Security-Policy, HSTS, and CORS.
  • A demo is worth a thousand words. See Fortify in action.

versions.releaseNotes: No longer attempts to inject scripts on non-HTML requests
